title: Dogtown Landscape
credit_line: Gift of Peggy J. Sweeney and Carol J. Schaffer in memory of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander H. Jackson
provenance_text:
William Austin Kienbusch [1914-1980], New York, NY and Cranberry Island, ME; Kraushaar Galleries, New York, NY [1]; Mr. and Mrs. Alexander H. Jackson, Pittsburgh, PA, by May 1, 1955 [2]; estate of Mrs. Alexander H. Jackson, Pittsburgh, PA; Mr. and Mrs. Jackson's daughters, Peggy J. Sweeney, Perosa Canavese, Italy and Carol J. Schaffer, Washington, D.C., by July 1983 until April 1984; gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, April 1984 [3].

Notes:
[1]. See reference to a Kraushaar label on the work in an appraisal dated October 14, 1983.
[2]. See original letter from the artist to Mr. and Mrs. Jackson, dated May 1, 1955 in reference to this work. Mr. and Mrs. Alexander H. Jackson lent the work to the exhibition "Art Since 1900 - Privately Owned in the Pittsburgh Area" held at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, January - February 1963.
[3]. Correspondence about this gift to Carnegie Institute was initiated in July 1983. The work was accessioned on April 5, 1984 as a gift of Peggy J. Sweeney and Carol J. Schaffer in memory of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander H. Jackson.

creator.birth_place: New York City (New York state, United States)
